Joint pain is common, especially as you get older. There are things you can do to ease the pain but get medical help if it's very painful or it does not get better.

sections.title: Types of joint pain
paragraphs: Common types of joint pain include:
You might feel pain in 1 joint, or more than 1 joint at the same time, such as your knees and hips.

sections.title: Causes of joint pain
paragraphs: There are many possible causes of joint pain. It might be caused by an injury or a longer-lasting problem such as arthritis.
Your symptoms might give you an idea what could be causing the pain. But do not self-diagnose, see a GP if you're worried.

sections.title: How you can ease joint pain
paragraphs: There are some things you can do to ease joint pain.

sections.title: Do
paragraphs: try to rest the affected joint if you can
put an ice pack (or bag of frozen peas) wrapped in a towel on the painful area for up to 20 minutes every 2 to 3 hours
take painkillers, such asibuprofenorparacetamol, but do not take ibuprofen in the first 48 hours after an injury
try to lose weight if you're overweight

sections.title: Don’t
paragraphs: do not carry anything heavy
do not completely stop moving the affected joint
